org.jetel.ctl.extensions

Class StringLibExt

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.jetel.ctl.extensions.TLFunctionLibrary
      • org.jetel.ctl.extensions.TLFunctionLibraryExt
        • org.jetel.ctl.extensions.StringLibExt
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    ITLFunctionLibrary

    public class StringLibExt
extends TLFunctionLibraryExt
    Library wrapper for additional string manipulation functions for CTL2.

    • Method Detail

      • rpad

        public static final java.lang.String rpad(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                    java.lang.String input,
                    java.lang.Integer targetLength)
        Pad input string with spaces from right.
        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to pad. Null is allowed and is returned without change.
        targetLength - required target length of the result. Only non-negative length is allowed.
        Returns:
        Input padded with spaces from right. Input longer than the target length is returned unchanged.

      • rpad

        public static final java.lang.String rpad(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                    java.lang.String input,
                    java.lang.Integer targetLength,
                    java.lang.String filler)
        Pad input string with specified characters from right.
        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to pad. Null is allowed and is returned without change.
        targetLength - required target length of the result. Only non-negative length is allowed.
        filler - character to use as padding. Only one character long strings are allowed.
        Returns:
        Input padded with specified character from right. Input longer than the target length is returned unchanged.

      • lpad

        public static final java.lang.String lpad(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                    java.lang.String input,
                    java.lang.Integer targetLength)
        Pad input string with spaces from left.
        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to pad. Null is allowed and is returned without change.
        targetLength - required target length of the result. Only non-negative length is allowed.
        Returns:
        Input padded with spaces from left. Input longer than the target length is returned unchanged.

      • lpad

        public static final java.lang.String lpad(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                    java.lang.String input,
                    java.lang.Integer targetLength,
                    java.lang.String filler)
        Pad input string with specified characters from left.
        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to pad. Null is allowed and is returned without change.
        targetLength - required target length of the result. Only non-negative length is allowed.
        filler - character to use as padding. Only one character long strings are allowed.
        Returns:
        Input padded with specified character from left. Input longer than the target length is returned unchanged.

      • lastIndexOf

        public static final int lastIndexOf(TLFunctionCallContext context,
              java.lang.String input,
              java.lang.String searchStr,
              java.lang.Integer fromIndex)

        Find the last occurrence of substring within given string searching backwards from given position.

        Function gracefully handles null values. Both searchStr and input can be null. -1 (not found) is returned in such case.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to search in. May be null.
        searchStr - string to search for. May be null.
        fromIndex - starting point of the search. Negative values are treated as zero. If start is greater than the length of the input, the whole input is searched.
        Returns:
        Index of the last occurrence of searchStr within input string. -1 is returned if the search string is not found in the input string.
        See Also:
        String.lastIndexOf(String, int)

      • lastIndexOf

        public static final int lastIndexOf(TLFunctionCallContext context,
              java.lang.String input,
              java.lang.String searchStr)

        Find the last occurrence of substring within given string.

        Function gracefully handles null values. Input can be null - -1 (not found) is returned in such case.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - string to search in. May be null.
        searchStr - string to search for. May not be null.
        Returns:
        Index of the last occurrence of searchStr within input string. -1 is returned if the search string is not found in the input string.
        See Also:
        #lastIndexOf(TLFunctionCallContext, String, String, int)

      • startsWith

        public static final boolean startsWith(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                 java.lang.String input,
                 java.lang.String prefix)

        Test if specified string starts with given prefix.

        Function gracefully handles null input:

        • null input string has no prefix, false is returned
        • Empty prefix is prefix of any non-null input string, true is returned if input is not null

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to test. May be null.
        prefix - prefix to test against. May not be null.
        Returns:
        true if input starts with specified prefix, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        String.startsWith(String)

      • endsWith

        public static final boolean endsWith(TLFunctionCallContext context,
               java.lang.String input,
               java.lang.String suffix)

        Test if specified string ends with given suffix.

        Function gracefully handles null input:

        • null input string has no suffix, false is returned
        • Empty suffix is suffix of any non-null input string, true is returned if input is not null

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to test. May be null.
        suffix - suffix to test against. May not be null.
        Returns:
        true if input ends with specified suffix, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        String.endsWith(String)

      • codePointToChar

        public static final java.lang.String codePointToChar(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                               java.lang.Integer codePoint)

        Converts the specified character (Unicode code point) to its UTF-16 representation.

        If the specified code point is a BMP (Basic Multilingual Plane or Plane 0) value, the resulting string contains one character with the same value as codePoint. If the specified code point is a supplementary code point, the result contains corresponding surrogate pair.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context
        codePoint - a Unicode code point. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        A string containing Unicode representation of specified code point.
        See Also:
        Character.toChars(int)

      • codePointAt

        public static final int codePointAt(TLFunctionCallContext context,
              java.lang.String input,
              java.lang.Integer index)

        Returns code point at the given position in the input string.

        If the char value at the given index is in the high-surrogate range, the following index is less than the length of the CharSequence, and the char value at the following index is in the low-surrogate range, then the supplementary code point corresponding to this surrogate pair is returned. Otherwise, the char value at the given index is returned.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - a Unicode string.
        index - the index of the code point to return. Has to be at least zero and length(input) - 1 at maximum.
        Returns:
        Code point at specified position in the input string.
        See Also:
        Character.codePointAt(CharSequence, int)

      • codePointLength

        public static final int codePointLength(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                  java.lang.Integer codePoint)

        Determine the number of characters needed to represent the specified Unicode code point.

        If the specified character is equal to or greater than 0x10000, then the method returns 2. Otherwise, the method returns 1.

        Note that code point is not validated. If validation is desired, isValidCodePoint should be used.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        codePoint - code point to test. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        number of characters needed to store specified Unicode code point.
        See Also:
        Character.charCount(int)

      • isValidCodePoint

        public static final boolean isValidCodePoint(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                       java.lang.Integer codePoint)
        Determine if specified value is valid Unicode code point value.
        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        codePoint - value to test. May be null.
        Returns:
        true if given value is valid Unicode code point, false otherwise. Null value is considered invalid.
        See Also:
        Character.isValidCodePoint(int)

      • unicodeNormalize

        public static final java.lang.String unicodeNormalize(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                java.lang.String input,
                                java.lang.String form)

        Normalize input using specified normalization form.

        Following normalization forms are supported:

        • NFD: canonical Unicode decomposition
        • NFC: canonical Unicode decomposition followed by canonical composition
        • NFKD: compatibility decomposition
        • NFKC: compatibility decomposition followed by canonical composition

        Function gracefully handles null input - null is simply passed through.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to normalize. May be null.
        form - specifies algorithm to use. Algorithm name is case insensitive. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        normalized input string or null if input is also null.
        See Also:
        Normalizer.normalize(CharSequence, Form)

      • isUnicodeNormalized

        public static final boolean isUnicodeNormalized(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                          java.lang.String input,
                          java.lang.String form)

        Determine if input string is Unicode normalized according to the given form.

        Following normalization forms are supported:

        • NFD: canonical Unicode decomposition
        • NFC: canonical Unicode decomposition followed by canonical composition
        • NFKD: compatibility decomposition
        • NFKC: compatibility decomposition followed by canonical composition

        Function gracefully handles null input - null is simply passed through.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to normalize. May be null.
        form - specifies algorithm to use. Algorithm name is case insensitive. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if input is normalized with respect to the selected form of if input is null. False is returned otherwise.
        See Also:
        Normalizer.isNormalized(CharSequence, Form)

      • contains

        public static final boolean contains(TLFunctionCallContext context,
               java.lang.String input,
               java.lang.String substring)

        Test if input string contains specified substring.

        This function handles null inputs gracefully. The function returns false for null input since it does not have any substrings.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string. May be null.
        substring - substring to search for. Cannot be null.
        Returns:
        true if input contains specified substring, false otherwise.
        See Also:
        String.contains(CharSequence)

      • concatWithSeparator

        public static final java.lang.String concatWithSeparator(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                   java.lang.String separator,
                                   java.lang.String... arguments)

        Concatenate list of strings into one string separating non-blank elements with separators.

        Example: concatWithSeparator(context, ", ", "first", "", null, "second") will result in "first, second"

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        separator - separator to use between the elements. Long separator (with more than one character) can be used. null separator is not allowed.
        arguments - elements to concatenate into the output. Blank values (as determined by isBlank function) are ignored and do not appear on the output.
        Returns:
        string created as concatenation of the specified values with non-blank values separated by specified separator. The function never returns null - empty argument list results in an empty string.

      • escapeUrlFragment

        public static final java.lang.String escapeUrlFragment(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                 java.lang.String input,
                                 java.lang.String encoding)

        Translate input into application/x-www-form-urlencoded format using specified character encoding.

        Note that this function does not try to interpret the input as URL. Therefore the input does not need to have valid (or known) protocol etc. Compare this to escapeURL function.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to translate. Null value is handled gracefully and will result into null output.
        encoding - encoding to use when translating the characters. Character encodings supported by Charset class can be used. UTF-8 is recommended. Encoding cannot be null.
        Returns:
        translated input string.
        See Also:
        URLEncoder.encode(String, String)

      • escapeUrlFragment

        public static final java.lang.String escapeUrlFragment(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                 java.lang.String input)

        Translate input into application/x-www-form-urlencoded format using UTF-8 character encoding.

        Note that this function does not try to interpret the input as URL. Therefore the input does not need to have valid (or known) protocol etc. Compare this to escapeURL function.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to translate. Null value is handled gracefully and will result into null output.
        Returns:
        translated input string.

      • unescapeUrlFragment

        public static final java.lang.String unescapeUrlFragment(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                   java.lang.String input,
                                   java.lang.String encoding)

        Decode application/x-www-form-urlencoded string using specified character encoding.

        Note that this function does not try to interpret the input as URL. Therefore the input does not need to have valid (or known) protocol etc. Compare this to escapeURL function.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to translate. Null value is handled gracefully and will result into null output.
        encoding - encoding to use when translating the characters. Character encodings supported by Charset class can be used. UTF-8 is recommended. Encoding cannot be null.
        Returns:
        translated input string.
        See Also:
        URLDecoder.decode(String, String)

      • unescapeUrlFragment

        public static final java.lang.String unescapeUrlFragment(TLFunctionCallContext context,
                                   java.lang.String input)

        Decode application/x-www-form-urlencoded string using UTF-8 character encoding.

        Note that this function does not try to interpret the input as URL. Therefore the input does not need to have valid (or known) protocol etc. Compare this to escapeURL function.

        Parameters:
        context - function call context.
        input - input string to translate. Null value is handled gracefully and will result into null output.
        Returns:
        translated input string.
